DataElement.preferredName: Urine Specimen Other Disease or Disorder Consent Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether consent was obtained from a person for the use of a urine specimen for research on other diseases or disorders, any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person, unrelated to cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Urine Specimen Other Disease or Disorder Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to consent by person for the use of a urine specimen for research on other diseases or disorders, any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person, unrelated to cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have you obtained the patient
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her urine to be kept for use in research about other health problems (for example: causes of diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, and heart disease)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her urine samples for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease.)

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Patient Consent Ind-3 2189909v1 with VD ID#3506034 - Yes No Unknown Indicator - dbw
